subject: [Radiance-general] Upgrading to R4: "There were some errors."
body:
Cramer,

It appears that your system's X11 header files are not in
/usr/include/X11. Every error in the output is because the
installer is looking in /usr/include/X11 for header files. The
warnings are all ignorable. And rtrace is still running the old
version, which doesn't have the "-n" option.

Do an "ls /usr/include/X11" and see if that directory contains
files like "Xutil.h" and "Xlib.h". If not, see if
/usr/include/X11R6, or some other directory like that contains
them. Once you've found them, when you run the makeall script,
choose to edit the makefile. Change the "-I/usr/include/X11" to
reflect the header files actual location.

I hope this helps.

Mark

PS. I use Fedora (10 now) and things work.
